The characters we are learning in this lesson are
sa, shi, su, se and so. These characters follow our
pattern of a, i, u, e and o. The slight exception to
this is 'shi', which adds a soft 'h' sound.
I'll pronounce each one for you as we go so you get
It's a consonant followed by a vowel, and makes up a

Like き, the number of strokes varies depending on the
font. Use the form in the animation as best practice.

Sensei is a word you've probably heard a lot in
movies and television. Sensei means teacher or master

Karaoke is a fun singing activity. Maybe you've
visited a karaoke club or sung karaoke at home before?

That's all for our Japanese words this lesson. Once

Do you remember our friend, the dakuten?
This guy lets us change the sound of Hiragana.
You'll remember we used it on the か series of
characters to turn their sound from 'k' to 'g'.
Here's some good news: we can use dakuten on our newly
Adding dakuten to the characters we learned in this
lesson transforms the sound from 's' to 'z'.
I'll go through our 5 new characters and show you
what they become when you add dakuten.
Write さ as normal, then add your dakuten marks in
the position shown in the image above.
Do you want me to pronounce it again?
Practice writing ざ in your notebook now.
You pronounce this as 'jee'. This character is an
exception in this set, as it's not a 'z' syllable.
Write し as normal, then add your dakuten marks in
the position shown in the image above.
Do you want me to pronounce it again?
Practice writing じ in your notebook now.
Write す as normal, then add your dakuten marks in
the position shown in the image above.
Do you want me to pronounce it again?
Practice writing ず in your notebook now.
Write せ as normal, then add your dakuten marks in
the position shown in the image above.
Do you want me to pronounce it again?
Practice writing ぜ in your notebook now.
Write そ as normal, then add your dakuten marks in
the position shown in the image above.
Do you want me to pronounce it again?
Practice writing ぞ in your notebook now.
We've now finished this set! From this lesson, you've
learned a total of 10 new Hiragana!
